Public Input for Remotely Conducted School Committee Meetings: Anyone wishing to provide public input at School Committee meetings that are being conducted remotely may submit their comments in writing to a dedicated email address that has been set up for this purpose.

The address is PublicInput@dracutps.org. All public input must be submitted no later than 11:59PM on the Sunday preceding a School Committee meeting. The Chair of the School Committee will read any comments into the record during the relevant School Committee meeting. Information on this may also be found on the district's website.

Remote School Committee meetings are live-streamed by Dracut Cable Access Television on channel 99. Regular School Committee meetings held on the 2nd and 4th Mondays of each month during the school year at 7PM.

Are you 55 or older and looking for something interesting, fun, and rewarding to do? Being a Foster Grandparent for young students in one of our elementary schools could be your answer.

Foster Grandparents are people who enjoy being with children who need love, attention, wisdom, and support. For over two decades, Foster Grandparents have made a difference in the lives of children in the Dracut Public Schools.

In exchange for committing as little as 15 hours per week in one of our elementary schools, Foster Grandparents, through Community Teamwork, Inc., a local non-profit community agency, benefit from:

- a monthly stipend
- a small travel reimbursement
- paid time off
- training
-formal and informal recognition

If you are interested, please contact Mary Donnelly, Foster Grandparent Staff Specialist at 978-654-5680 for more information.

For the Englesby, Beth McCloskey supported William Dubois, Adam Felle, Randall Langford, Scott Johnston, Brennan Kunicki, Maliyana Sok Alyssa Bergeron, Josephine Dorgbadzi, Riley Johnson, Carlos Marquez, Jonathan Muhoro and Joshua Milt.

Congratulations to all of the students, thanks to our teachers for their support, and thank you to Merrimack Valley robotics for their sponsorship of the event.

UPDATE ON THE STATUS OF THE SCHOOLS 10/31/17: As of tonight a significant portion of the town still has no power. As for the schools, at this time only the Campbell Elementary School has power.

I have been in communication with the Town Manager as well as the Dracut Police and Fire Departments throughout the past two days. I can report that all parties have been in close communication with National Grid in an attempt to get power restored throughout town, including the schools, as quickly as possible.

Work to restore power will continue through the night. Given that a significant number of children have been living in homes without power for a number of days, every effort will be made to open the schools and provide warm environments should power be restored overnight. As such, a decision on school tomorrow will not be made until early tomorrow morning.

Again, as is most often the case with weather events, a decision about school will be made early tomorrow morning. I appreciate everyone’s understanding and will communicate with you once a decision has been made.

Today, Seniors at Dracut High participated in the annual Money Strong For Life event sponsored and supported by Jeanne D'Arc Credit Union and 60 of its volunteer employees. Students participated in an interactive, relevant version of the game of Life; with efforts focused on developing financial literacy.

Students began by selecting a credit card, one of which came with a real Dunkin Donuts gift card but with fine print indicating its interest rate was almost 30% (about 20% of the students chose the card with the DD gift card, and groaned audibly when told about the fine print). Students then went to stations that offered choices (insurance, automobile choices etc) and some luck. Some students were lucky enough to become parents for the fair and had to make decisions based on the very real cost and lifestyle choices that come with parenthood (pictured: Rodrigo Garcia and Mateus Ibarguen).

Huge thanks to Mr. Mone for his continued efforts at organizing this event, and to Jeanne D'Arc Credit Union and its employees...
